title: Color Scales
text: scale_color_aib() scale_fill_aib() map categorical variables eight-color brand palette. Colors ordered maximum visual contrast.   palette contains eight colors. data eight levels warning issued.
code: set.seed(42) districts <- data.frame(   spending = c(rnorm(30, 11, 2), rnorm(30, 15, 2.5), rnorm(30, 13, 3)),   avg_score = c(rnorm(30, 250, 15), rnorm(30, 270, 12), rnorm(30, 258, 18)),   urbanicity = rep(c("Urban", "Suburban", "Rural"), each = 30) )  ggplot(districts, aes(spending, avg_score, color = urbanicity)) +   geom_point(size = 2) +   scale_color_aib() +   labs(     title = "Discrete Color Scale",     x = "Per-Pupil Spending ($1,000s)",     y = "Average Score"   ) +   theme_aib() enrollment <- data.frame(   sector = c("Public", "Charter", "Magnet", "Private"),   pct = c(79.8, 6.2, 4.2, 9.8) ) enrollment$sector <- factor(enrollment$sector, levels = enrollment$sector)  ggplot(enrollment, aes(sector, pct, fill = sector)) +   geom_col() +   scale_fill_aib() +   labs(     title = "Discrete Fill Scale",     x = NULL,     y = "Percent"   ) +   theme_aib() +   theme(legend.position = "none")

title: Color Scales
text: scale_color_aib_c() scale_fill_aib_c() create two-color gradient. default runs navy sky.  Override endpoints low high arguments:
code: set.seed(42) schools <- data.frame(   enrollment = runif(80, 200, 1500),   avg_score = rnorm(80, 260, 20),   st_ratio = runif(80, 10, 30) ) schools$avg_score <- schools$avg_score - (schools$st_ratio - 20) * 1.5  ggplot(schools, aes(enrollment, avg_score, color = st_ratio)) +   geom_point(size = 2) +   scale_color_aib_c() +   scale_x_continuous(labels = aib_label("comma")) +   labs(     title = "Continuous Color Scale",     x = "Enrollment",     y = "Avg. Test Score",     color = "Student-Teacher\nRatio"   ) +   theme_aib() ggplot(schools, aes(enrollment, avg_score, color = st_ratio)) +   geom_point(size = 2) +   scale_color_aib_c(     low = aib_colors("emerald"),     high = aib_colors("yellow")   ) +   scale_x_continuous(labels = aib_label("comma")) +   labs(     title = "Custom Gradient Endpoints",     x = "Enrollment",     y = "Avg. Test Score",     color = "Student-Teacher\nRatio"   ) +   theme_aib()

title: Color Scales
text: scale_color_aib_div() scale_fill_aib_div() create three-color gradient highlights deviations central value. default runs red light gray navy, centered zero.  Adjust midpoint colors needed:
code: set.seed(42) districts2 <- data.frame(   enrollment = runif(80, 500, 5000),   avg_score = rnorm(80, 255, 20),   spending_change = rnorm(80, 0, 6) )  ggplot(districts2, aes(enrollment, avg_score, color = spending_change)) +   geom_point(size = 2) +   scale_color_aib_div() +   scale_x_continuous(labels = aib_label("comma")) +   labs(     title = "Diverging Color Scale",     x = "Enrollment",     y = "Avg. Test Score",     color = "Spending\nChange (%)"   ) +   theme_aib() ggplot(districts2, aes(enrollment, avg_score, color = spending_change)) +   geom_point(size = 2) +   scale_color_aib_div(midpoint = 2) +   scale_x_continuous(labels = aib_label("comma")) +   labs(     title = "Shifted Midpoint",     x = "Enrollment",     y = "Avg. Test Score",     color = "Spending\nChange (%)"   ) +   theme_aib()

title: Color Scales
text: scale functions pass additional arguments (...) underlying ggplot2 scale, parameter supported discrete_scale(), scale_color_gradient(), scale_color_gradient2() can used.

title: Font System
text: Every theme_aib() variant assigns fonts plot elements three roles: Retrieve active family name role aib_font(): retrieve three :
code: library(ggaib) #> Brand fonts not found. Using bundled alternatives (Albert Sans, Source Sans 3, Crimson Text).  aib_font("heading") #> [1] "Albert Sans" aib_font("body") #> [1] "Source Sans 3" aib_font("serif") #> [1] "Crimson Text" str(aib_font_families()) #> List of 3 #>  $ heading: chr "Albert Sans" #>  $ body   : chr "Source Sans 3" #>  $ serif  : chr "Crimson Text"

title: Font System
text: package loads works three-tier priority list role: Brand font — preferred font (e.g. Area Normal) installed system, used directly. Bundled alternative — brand font found, ggaib registers open-source substitute shipped package’s inst/fonts directory using systemfonts::register_font(). alternative bundled four weights (regular, italic, bold, bold italic). System default — font registration fails entirely (example, systemfonts unavailable), package falls back generic "sans" "serif" families. bundled fonts included package , fallback works offline require downloading anything runtime.

title: Font System
text: ggaib attached prints single line indicating tier active. message corresponds one four scenarios: see “bundled alternatives” message, plots still look consistent — open-source fonts chosen close typographic matches brand typefaces.
code: ## All brand fonts installed Using AIB brand fonts (Area Normal, Source Sans Pro, Minion Pro).  ## No brand fonts; bundled alternatives registered Brand fonts not found. Using bundled alternatives (Albert Sans, Source Sans 3, Crimson Text).  ## Font registration failed Font registration failed. Using system defaults (sans/serif).  ## Mixed (some brand, some bundled) Fonts: Area Normal (brand), Source Sans 3 (bundled), Crimson Text (bundled).

title: Font System
text: font system relies systemfonts package register bundled fonts. registered fonts render correctly, use graphics device supports systemfonts, ragg package: RStudio Quarto use ragg default installed. RMarkdown document, set device chunk options:
code: # In an R script ragg::agg_png("plot.png", width = 7, height = 5, units = "in", res = 300) print(p) dev.off() ```{r, dev = "ragg_png"} ```

title: Getting Started with ggaib
text: ggaib package provides ggplot2 themes color scales Annenberg Institute Brown University. includes three theme variants discrete, continuous, diverging color scales using Institute’s brand palette.
code: library(ggaib) #> Brand fonts not found. Using bundled alternatives (Albert Sans, Source Sans 3, Crimson Text). library(ggplot2)

title: Getting Started with ggaib
text: Access full palette select specific colors:
code: aib_colors() #>      navy       red   emerald    yellow       sky     taupe     brown      gray  #> "#1B3E6F" "#C00404" "#00AF9A" "#EBA900" "#55C8E8" "#B6B09D" "#503629" "#97A3AE" aib_colors("navy", "red", "emerald") #>      navy       red   emerald  #> "#1B3E6F" "#C00404" "#00AF9A"

title: Getting Started with ggaib
text: three core themes included ggaib package, optimized different use case. themes share base font color palette, differ gridline axis styling suit different types visualizations.

title: Getting Started with ggaib
code: set.seed(42) districts <- data.frame(   spending = c(rnorm(40, 11, 2), rnorm(40, 15, 2.5), rnorm(40, 13, 3)),   avg_score = c(rnorm(40, 250, 15), rnorm(40, 270, 12), rnorm(40, 258, 18)),   urbanicity = rep(c("Urban", "Suburban", "Rural"), each = 40) )  ggplot(districts, aes(spending, avg_score, color = urbanicity)) +   geom_point(size = 2) +   scale_color_aib() +   scale_x_continuous(labels = aib_label("dollar")) +   scale_y_continuous(limits = c(215, 300), breaks = seq(200, 300, 20)) +   labs(     title = "Per-Pupil Spending and Math Achievement",     x = "Per-Pupil Expenditures\n($1,000s)",     y = "Avgerage Math Score",     caption = "Note: Simulated data for illustration"   ) +   theme_aib() +   aib_color_title(     "For Urban, Suburban, and Rural school districts",     colors = c(       "Urban"    = unname(aib_colors("navy")),       "Suburban" = unname(aib_colors("red")),       "Rural"    = unname(aib_colors("emerald"))     ),     element = "subtitle"   ) +   theme(legend.position = "none")

title: Getting Started with ggaib
code: set.seed(42) years <- 2005:2023 gap_data <- data.frame(   year = rep(years, 2),   group = rep(c("Higher-Income", "Lower-Income"), each = length(years)),   score = c(     270 + cumsum(rnorm(length(years), 0.3, 0.8)),     240 + cumsum(rnorm(length(years), 0.8, 0.9))   ) )  ggplot(gap_data, aes(year, score, color = group)) +   geom_line(linewidth = 1) +   scale_color_aib() +   scale_x_continuous(breaks = seq(2005, 2025, 3)) +   labs(     title = "Reading Achievement Gap Over Time",     x = NULL,     y = "Average Reading Score"   ) +   theme_aib_grid() +   aib_color_title(     "Higher-Income and Lower-Income 4th-grade scores",     colors = c(       "Higher-Income" = unname(aib_colors("navy")),       "Lower-Income"  = unname(aib_colors("red"))     ),     element = "subtitle"   ) +   aib_direct_label(gap_data, "year", "score", "group",                    limits = c(215, 300), breaks = seq(200, 300, 20))

title: Getting Started with ggaib
code: set.seed(42) states <- ggplot2::map_data("state") spending_by_state <- data.frame(   region = unique(states$region),   spending = runif(length(unique(states$region)), 7, 24) ) map_df <- merge(states, spending_by_state, by = "region")  ggplot(map_df, aes(long, lat, group = group, fill = spending)) +   geom_polygon(color = "white", linewidth = 0.2) +   scale_fill_aib_c() +   labs(     title = "Per-Pupil Spending by State",     fill = "$ (1,000s)",     caption = "Note: Simulated data for illustration"   ) +   coord_fixed(1.3) +   theme_aib_map()

title: Getting Started with ggaib
code: set.seed(42) schools <- data.frame(   enrollment = runif(80, 200, 1500),   avg_score = rnorm(80, 260, 20),   st_ratio = runif(80, 10, 30) ) schools$avg_score <- schools$avg_score - (schools$st_ratio - 20) * 1.5  ggplot(schools, aes(enrollment, avg_score, color = st_ratio)) +   geom_point(size = 2) +   scale_color_aib_c() +   scale_x_continuous(labels = aib_label("comma"), breaks = seq(0, 1500, 300)) +   scale_y_continuous(limits = c(215, 300), breaks = seq(200, 300, 20)) +   labs(     title = "Student-Teacher Ratio Across Schools",     x = "Enrollment",     y = "Avg. Test Score",     color = "Student-Teacher\nRatio"   ) +   theme_aib() #> Warning: Removed 3 rows containing missing values or values outside the scale range #> (`geom_point()`).

title: Getting Started with ggaib
code: set.seed(42) districts2 <- data.frame(   enrollment = runif(80, 500, 5000),   avg_score = rnorm(80, 255, 20),   spending_change = rnorm(80, 0, 6) )  ggplot(districts2, aes(enrollment, avg_score, color = spending_change)) +   geom_point(size = 2) +   scale_color_aib_div() +   scale_x_continuous(labels = aib_label("comma"), breaks = seq(0, 5000, 500)) +   scale_y_continuous(limits = c(215, 300), breaks = seq(200, 300, 20)) +   labs(     title = "Year-over-Year Spending Change",     x = "Enrollment",     y = "Avg. Test Score",     color = "Spending\nChange (%)"   ) +   theme_aib() #> Warning: Removed 2 rows containing missing values or values outside the scale range #> (`geom_point()`).

title: Axis Labels
code: enrollment <- data.frame(   sector = c("Public", "Charter", "Magnet", "Private"),   students = c(47.3, 3.7, 2.5, 5.7) * 1e6 ) enrollment$sector <- factor(enrollment$sector, levels = enrollment$sector)  ggplot(enrollment, aes(sector, students, fill = sector)) +   geom_col() +   scale_fill_aib() +   scale_y_continuous(labels = aib_label("comma")) +   labs(title = "Comma Format", x = NULL, y = "Students") +   theme_aib() +   theme(legend.position = "none")

title: Axis Labels
code: spending <- data.frame(   state = c("NY", "NJ", "CT", "MA", "VT"),   ppexp = c(26.6, 21.0, 21.8, 18.6, 20.3) * 1000 ) spending$state <- factor(spending$state, levels = spending$state)  ggplot(spending, aes(state, ppexp, fill = state)) +   geom_col() +   scale_fill_aib() +   scale_y_continuous(labels = aib_label("dollar")) +   labs(title = "Dollar Format", x = NULL, y = "Per-Pupil Spending") +   theme_aib() +   theme(legend.position = "none")

title: Axis Labels
code: grad <- data.frame(   year = 2015:2023,   rate = seq(0.83, 0.87, length.out = 9) + rnorm(9, 0, 0.005) )  ggplot(grad, aes(year, rate)) +   geom_line(linewidth = 1, color = aib_colors("navy")) +   geom_point(size = 2, color = aib_colors("navy")) +   scale_y_continuous(labels = aib_label("percent")) +   labs(title = "Percent Format", x = NULL, y = "Graduation Rate") +   theme_aib_grid()

title: Axis Labels
code: set.seed(42) effects <- data.frame(   program = c("Tutoring", "Summer School", "Mentoring", "After-School"),   effect = c(3.2, 1.8, 2.5, 1.1) ) effects$program <- factor(effects$program, levels = effects$program)  ggplot(effects, aes(program, effect, fill = program)) +   geom_col() +   scale_fill_aib() +   scale_y_continuous(labels = aib_label("pp")) +   labs(     title = "Percentage Point Format",     x = NULL,     y = "Effect on Graduation Rate"   ) +   theme_aib() +   theme(legend.position = "none")

title: Axis Labels
text: Pass aib_label() labels argument continuous scale: formats covered aib_label(), use scales package directly.
code: scale_x_continuous(labels = aib_label("dollar")) scale_y_continuous(labels = aib_label("percent"))

title: Brand Palette
text: Call aib_colors() arguments see full palette: Pass color names select specific values: error raised invalid names:
code: aib_colors() #>      navy       red   emerald    yellow       sky     taupe     brown      gray  #> "#1B3E6F" "#C00404" "#00AF9A" "#EBA900" "#55C8E8" "#B6B09D" "#503629" "#97A3AE" aib_colors("navy", "red", "emerald") #>      navy       red   emerald  #> "#1B3E6F" "#C00404" "#00AF9A" aib_colors("purple") #> Error: #> ! purple not valid AIB colors. Choose from: navy, red, emerald, yellow, sky, taupe, brown, gray

title: Brand Palette
code: cols <- aib_colors() df <- data.frame(   name = factor(names(cols), levels = names(cols)),   y = 1 )  ggplot(df, aes(name, y, fill = name)) +   geom_tile(color = "white", linewidth = 1) +   scale_fill_manual(values = cols) +   labs(title = "AIB Brand Palette") +   theme_aib() +   theme(     axis.title = element_blank(),     axis.text.y = element_blank(),     axis.ticks = element_blank(),     axis.line = element_blank(),     legend.position = "none"   )

title: Brand Palette
text: aib_colors() returns standard hex codes, values can used anywhere ggplot2 accepts color string:
code: set.seed(42) df <- data.frame(x = 1:50, y = cumsum(rnorm(50)))  ggplot(df, aes(x, y)) +   geom_line(linewidth = 1, color = aib_colors("navy")) +   geom_hline(     yintercept = 0,     linetype = "dashed",     color = aib_colors("gray")   ) +   labs(title = "Using Colors Directly", x = NULL, y = NULL) +   theme_aib_grid()

title: Brand Palette
text: aib_pal() returns function generates n colors palette. engine behind scale_color_aib() scale_fill_aib(), can also used : useful need brand colors outside ggplot2 scale, example building custom legend annotating plot colored text.

title: Preparing Figures for Presentations
code: ggplot(enrollment, aes(type, students, fill = type)) +   geom_col() +   scale_fill_aib() +   scale_y_continuous(labels = aib_label("comma")) +   labs(     title = "U.S. K\u201312 Enrollment by Sector",     x = NULL,     y = "Students"   ) +   theme_aib() +   theme(legend.position = "none")

title: Preparing Figures for Presentations
code: ggplot(enrollment, aes(type, students, fill = type)) +   geom_col() +   scale_fill_aib() +   scale_y_continuous(labels = aib_label("comma")) +   labs(     title = "U.S. K\u201312 Enrollment by Sector",     x = NULL,     y = "Students"   ) +   theme_aib(base_size = 16) +   theme(legend.position = "none")

title: Preparing Figures for Presentations
text: presentation software uses 16:9 aspect ratio. good starting point export 10 5.625 inches (proportional 8.75 6.25 1.4:1 ratio leaves room slide titles):
code: ggsave(   "figure.png",   width = 10,   height = 5.625,   dpi = 300 )

title: Preparing Figures for Presentations
text: slide includes time-series scatter plot readers need trace values, use theme_aib_grid() increased base_size:
code: set.seed(42) years <- 2005:2023 gap_data <- data.frame(   year = rep(years, 2),   group = rep(c("Higher-Income", "Lower-Income"), each = length(years)),   score = c(     270 + cumsum(rnorm(length(years), 0.3, 0.8)),     240 + cumsum(rnorm(length(years), 0.8, 0.9))   ) )  ggplot(gap_data, aes(year, score, color = group)) +   geom_line(linewidth = 1) +   scale_color_aib() +   scale_x_continuous(breaks = seq(2005, 2025, 3)) +   labs(     title = "Reading Achievement Gap Over Time",     x = NULL,     y = "Average Reading Score"   ) +   theme_aib_grid(base_size = 16) +   aib_color_title(     "Higher-Income and Lower-Income 4th-grade scores",     colors = c(       "Higher-Income" = unname(aib_colors("navy")),       "Lower-Income"  = unname(aib_colors("red"))     ),     element = "subtitle"   ) +   aib_direct_label(gap_data, "year", "score", "group",                    limits = c(215, 300), breaks = seq(200, 300, 20))

title: Themes
text: default theme targets journal articles reports. uses clean, minimal design gridlines, thin axis lines, bottom legend.
code: set.seed(42) districts <- data.frame(   spending = c(rnorm(40, 11, 2), rnorm(40, 15, 2.5)),   avg_score = c(rnorm(40, 250, 15), rnorm(40, 270, 12)),   type = rep(c("Urban", "Suburban"), each = 40) )  ggplot(districts, aes(spending, avg_score, color = type)) +   geom_point(size = 2) +   scale_color_aib() +   scale_x_continuous(labels = aib_label("dollar")) +   scale_y_continuous(limits = c(215, 300), breaks = seq(200, 300, 20)) +   labs(     title = "Per-Pupil Spending and Math Scores",     x = "Per-Pupil Expenditures ($1,000s)",     y = "Average Math Score",     caption = "Note: Simulated data for illustration"   ) +   theme_aib() +   aib_color_title(     "Urban and Suburban school districts",     colors = c(       "Urban"    = unname(aib_colors("navy")),       "Suburban" = unname(aib_colors("red"))     ),     element = "subtitle"   ) +   theme(legend.position = "none")

title: Themes
text: theme variants accept gridlines argument. Use "x", "y", "xy" add light gray major gridlines:
code: ggplot(districts, aes(spending, avg_score, color = type)) +   geom_point(size = 2) +   scale_color_aib() +   scale_x_continuous(labels = aib_label("dollar")) +   scale_y_continuous(limits = c(215, 300), breaks = seq(200, 300, 20)) +   labs(     title = "Adding Horizontal Gridlines",     x = "Per-Pupil Expenditures ($1,000s)",     y = "Average Math Score"   ) +   theme_aib(gridlines = "y")

title: Themes
text: Identical theme_aib() defaults gridlines = "xy". Use time-series scatter plots gridlines help readers trace values.
code: set.seed(42) years <- 2005:2023 gap_data <- data.frame(   year = rep(years, 2),   group = rep(c("Higher-Income", "Lower-Income"), each = length(years)),   score = c(     270 + cumsum(rnorm(length(years), 0.3, 0.8)),     240 + cumsum(rnorm(length(years), 0.8, 0.9))   ) )  ggplot(gap_data, aes(year, score, color = group)) +   geom_line(linewidth = 1) +   scale_color_aib() +   scale_x_continuous(breaks = seq(2005, 2025, 3)) +   labs(     title = "Reading Achievement Gap Over Time",     x = NULL,     y = "Average Reading Score"   ) +   theme_aib_grid() +   aib_color_title(     "Higher-Income and Lower-Income 4th-grade scores",     colors = c(       "Higher-Income" = unname(aib_colors("navy")),       "Lower-Income"  = unname(aib_colors("red"))     ),     element = "subtitle"   ) +   aib_direct_label(gap_data, "year", "score", "group",                    limits = c(215, 300), breaks = seq(200, 300, 20))

title: Themes
text: Removes axis lines, ticks, labels, titles. Retains plot title, subtitle, caption, legend styling.
code: set.seed(42) states <- ggplot2::map_data("state") spending_by_state <- data.frame(   region = unique(states$region),   spending = runif(length(unique(states$region)), 7, 24) ) map_df <- merge(states, spending_by_state, by = "region")  ggplot(map_df, aes(long, lat, group = group, fill = spending)) +   geom_polygon(color = "white", linewidth = 0.2) +   scale_fill_aib_c() +   labs(     title = "Per-Pupil Spending by State",     fill = "$ (1,000s)",     caption = "Note: Simulated data for illustration"   ) +   coord_fixed(1.3) +   theme_aib_map()

title: Themes
text: three themes accept arguments: - base_size — Base font size points (default 11). Increase 16 higher presentations (see vignette("presentations")). - base_family — Override base font family. NULL (default), registered AIB body font used. - gridlines — major gridlines draw: "none", "x", "y", "xy".

title: ggplot2 Themes for the Annenberg Institute at Brown University
text: Themes — Publication, data-dense, map variants Color Scales — Discrete, continuous, diverging palettes Labels — Dollar, comma, percent axis formatters Palettes — Direct access brand colors Font System — Automatic font registration bundled fallbacks

title: ggplot2 Themes for the Annenberg Institute at Brown University
code: # install.packages("devtools") devtools::install_github("andrewmcamp/ggaib")

title: ggplot2 Themes for the Annenberg Institute at Brown University
text: Read introduction vignette guided tour, browse function reference.

title: Colored Title or Subtitle — aib_color_title
text: Creates plot title subtitle specific words phrases rendered color. Designed companion aib_direct_label() group names title match line colors, replacing need legend.

title: Colored Title or Subtitle — aib_color_title
code: aib_color_title(text, colors, element = c("title", "subtitle"))

title: Colored Title or Subtitle — aib_color_title
text: text single character string title subtitle. colors named character vector mapping substrings colors (e.g., c("Group " = "#1B3E6F")). name found text wrapped colored HTML span. element text element set: "title" "subtitle".

title: Colored Title or Subtitle — aib_color_title
text: list ggplot2 components can added plot +. includes partial ggplot2::theme() modification, add base theme (e.g., theme_aib()) + chain.

title: Colored Title or Subtitle — aib_color_title
code: library(ggplot2) df <- data.frame(   year = rep(2020:2024, 2),   value = c(1:5, 5:1),   group = rep(c("A", "B"), each = 5) ) ggplot(df, aes(year, value, color = group)) +   geom_line() +   scale_color_aib() +   theme_aib() +   aib_color_title(     "A outperformed B over time",     colors = c("A" = "#1B3E6F", "B" = "#C00404")   )

title: Annenberg Institute Brand Colors — aib_colors
text: Returns named character vector hex color codes Annenberg Institute brand palette. Pass color names select specific colors.

title: Annenberg Institute Brand Colors — aib_colors
code: aib_colors(...)

title: Annenberg Institute Brand Colors — aib_colors
text: ... Color names select. empty, returns colors.

title: Annenberg Institute Brand Colors — aib_colors
text: named character vector hex color codes.

title: Annenberg Institute Brand Colors — aib_colors
code: aib_colors() #>      navy       red   emerald    yellow       sky     taupe     brown      gray  #> "#1B3E6F" "#C00404" "#00AF9A" "#EBA900" "#55C8E8" "#B6B09D" "#503629" "#97A3AE"  aib_colors("navy", "red") #>      navy       red  #> "#1B3E6F" "#C00404"

what: Direct Labels on a Secondary Y-Axis — aib_direct_label
title: Direct Labels on a Secondary Y-Axis — aib_direct_label
text: Replaces legend group labels placed secondary y-axis, aligned group's final value. Label colors match group colors easy identification.

title: Direct Labels on a Secondary Y-Axis — aib_direct_label
code: aib_direct_label(data, x, y, group, colors = NULL, adjust = NULL, ...)

title: Direct Labels on a Secondary Y-Axis — aib_direct_label
text: data Data frame used plot. x, y, group String column names x-axis, y-axis, grouping variable. colors Optional named character vector mapping group names colors (e.g., c("Group " = "#1B3E6F")). Defaults aib_colors() palette order, matching scale_color_aib(). adjust Optional named numeric vector vertical adjustments prevent label overlap (e.g., c("Group " = 0.5)). Groups listed receive adjustment. ... Additional arguments passed ggplot2::scale_y_continuous() (e.g., limits, breaks, labels).

title: Direct Labels on a Secondary Y-Axis — aib_direct_label
text: list ggplot2 components can added plot +. includes partial ggplot2::theme() modification, add base theme (e.g., theme_aib()) + chain.

title: Direct Labels on a Secondary Y-Axis — aib_direct_label
text: function sets ggplot2::scale_y_continuous() secondary axis, used instead (alongside) separate scale_y_continuous() call.

title: Direct Labels on a Secondary Y-Axis — aib_direct_label
code: library(ggplot2) df <- data.frame(   year = rep(2020:2024, 2),   value = c(1:5, 5:1),   group = rep(c("A", "B"), each = 5) ) ggplot(df, aes(year, value, color = group)) +   geom_line() +   scale_color_aib() +   theme_aib() +   aib_direct_label(df, "year", "value", "group")

title: AIB Font Family Names — aib_font
text: Returns registered font family name given role. font system prefers locally installed brand fonts falls back bundled font files shipped package.

title: AIB Font Family Names — aib_font
code: aib_font(role = c("heading", "body", "serif"))

title: AIB Font Family Names — aib_font
text: role One "heading", "body", "serif".

title: AIB Font Family Names — aib_font
text: character string font family name.

title: AIB Font Family Names — aib_font
code: aib_font("heading") #> [1] "Albert Sans" aib_font("body") #> [1] "Source Sans 3"

title: All AIB Font Families — aib_font_families
text: Returns named list font family names roles.

title: All AIB Font Families — aib_font_families
code: aib_font_families()

title: All AIB Font Families — aib_font_families
text: named list elements heading, body, serif.

title: Axis Label Formatters — aib_label
text: Convenience wrapper returns label functions common axis formats. returned function can passed directly labels argument scale_*_continuous() call.

title: Axis Label Formatters — aib_label
code: aib_label(type = c("comma", "dollar", "percent", "pp"))

title: Axis Label Formatters — aib_label
text: type Label type. One "comma", "dollar", "percent", "pp" (percentage points).

title: Axis Label Formatters — aib_label
text: labeler function suitable ggplot2::scale_x_continuous() ggplot2::scale_y_continuous().

title: Axis Label Formatters — aib_label
code: library(ggplot2) ggplot(data.frame(x = 1:5, y = seq(1000, 5000, 1000)), aes(x, y)) +   geom_col() +   scale_y_continuous(labels = aib_label("dollar")) +   theme_aib()

what: Annenberg Institute Color Palette Function — aib_pal
title: Annenberg Institute Color Palette Function — aib_pal
text: Returns function generates n colors AIB brand palette. Intended use inside ggplot2 scale functions.

title: Annenberg Institute Color Palette Function — aib_pal
code: aib_pal()

title: Annenberg Institute Color Palette Function — aib_pal
text: function takes integer n returns n hex color codes.

title: Annenberg Institute Color Palette Function — aib_pal

what: ggaib: ggplot2 Themes for the Annenberg Institute at Brown University — ggaib-package
title: ggaib: ggplot2 Themes for the Annenberg Institute at Brown University — ggaib-package
text: Provides ggplot2 themes color scales following visual identity Annenberg Institute Brown University. Includes publication, presentation, map, data-dense theme variants plus discrete, continuous, diverging color scales using Institute's brand palette.

title: ggaib: ggplot2 Themes for the Annenberg Institute at Brown University — ggaib-package
text: Maintainer: Andrew Camp andrew_camp@brown.edu

title: Register AIB fonts — register_aib_fonts
text: Checks locally installed preferred fonts. found, registers bundled fallback fonts package's inst/fonts directory via systemfonts. Falls back "sans" roles font registration fails.

title: Register AIB fonts — register_aib_fonts
code: register_aib_fonts()

title: Discrete AIB Color Scale — scale_color_aib
text: Maps categorical variables Annenberg Institute brand palette. Colors ordered maximum visual contrast.

title: Discrete AIB Color Scale — scale_color_aib
code: scale_color_aib(...)  scale_colour_aib(...)

title: Discrete AIB Color Scale — scale_color_aib
text: ... Additional arguments passed ggplot2::discrete_scale().

title: Discrete AIB Color Scale — scale_color_aib
text: ggplot2 discrete color scale.

title: Discrete AIB Color Scale — scale_color_aib
code: library(ggplot2) ggplot(mtcars, aes(mpg, wt, color = factor(cyl))) +   geom_point() +   scale_color_aib()

title: Continuous AIB Color Scale — scale_color_aib_c
text: Creates continuous color gradient two brand colors. Defaults navy--sky gradient.

title: Continuous AIB Color Scale — scale_color_aib_c
code: scale_color_aib_c(low = "#1B3E6F", high = "#55C8E8", ...)  scale_colour_aib_c(low = "#1B3E6F", high = "#55C8E8", ...)

title: Continuous AIB Color Scale — scale_color_aib_c
text: low Color low end gradient. Default AIB navy. high Color high end gradient. Default AIB sky. ... Additional arguments passed ggplot2::scale_color_gradient().

title: Continuous AIB Color Scale — scale_color_aib_c
text: ggplot2 continuous color scale.

title: Continuous AIB Color Scale — scale_color_aib_c
code: library(ggplot2) ggplot(mtcars, aes(mpg, wt, color = hp)) +   geom_point() +   scale_color_aib_c()

title: Diverging AIB Color Scale — scale_color_aib_div
text: Creates diverging color gradient. Defaults red-gray-navy.

title: Diverging AIB Color Scale — scale_color_aib_div
code: scale_color_aib_div(   low = "#C00404",   mid = "#D0D0D0",   high = "#1B3E6F",   midpoint = 0,   ... )  scale_colour_aib_div(   low = "#C00404",   mid = "#D0D0D0",   high = "#1B3E6F",   midpoint = 0,   ... )

title: Diverging AIB Color Scale — scale_color_aib_div
text: low Color low end. Default AIB red. mid Color midpoint. Default light gray. high Color high end. Default AIB navy. midpoint data value mapped midpoint color. Default 0. ... Additional arguments passed ggplot2::scale_color_gradient2().

title: Diverging AIB Color Scale — scale_color_aib_div
text: ggplot2 diverging color scale.

title: Diverging AIB Color Scale — scale_color_aib_div
code: library(ggplot2) ggplot(mtcars, aes(mpg, wt, color = hp - mean(hp))) +   geom_point() +   scale_color_aib_div()

title: Discrete AIB Fill Scale — scale_fill_aib
text: Maps categorical variables Annenberg Institute brand palette fill aesthetics.

title: Discrete AIB Fill Scale — scale_fill_aib
code: scale_fill_aib(...)

title: Discrete AIB Fill Scale — scale_fill_aib
text: ... Additional arguments passed ggplot2::discrete_scale().

title: Discrete AIB Fill Scale — scale_fill_aib
text: ggplot2 discrete fill scale.

title: Discrete AIB Fill Scale — scale_fill_aib
code: library(ggplot2) ggplot(mtcars, aes(factor(cyl), fill = factor(cyl))) +   geom_bar() +   scale_fill_aib()

title: Continuous AIB Fill Scale — scale_fill_aib_c
text: Creates continuous fill gradient two brand colors.

title: Continuous AIB Fill Scale — scale_fill_aib_c
code: scale_fill_aib_c(low = "#1B3E6F", high = "#55C8E8", ...)

title: Continuous AIB Fill Scale — scale_fill_aib_c
text: low Color low end gradient. Default AIB navy. high Color high end gradient. Default AIB sky. ... Additional arguments passed ggplot2::scale_fill_gradient().

title: Continuous AIB Fill Scale — scale_fill_aib_c
text: ggplot2 continuous fill scale.

title: Diverging AIB Fill Scale — scale_fill_aib_div
text: Creates diverging fill gradient. Defaults red-gray-navy.

title: Diverging AIB Fill Scale — scale_fill_aib_div
code: scale_fill_aib_div(   low = "#C00404",   mid = "#D0D0D0",   high = "#1B3E6F",   midpoint = 0,   ... )

title: Diverging AIB Fill Scale — scale_fill_aib_div
text: low Color low end. Default AIB red. mid Color midpoint. Default light gray. high Color high end. Default AIB navy. midpoint data value mapped midpoint color. Default 0. ... Additional arguments passed ggplot2::scale_fill_gradient2().

title: Diverging AIB Fill Scale — scale_fill_aib_div
text: ggplot2 diverging fill scale.

title: Annenberg Institute Base Theme — theme_aib
text: minimal, publication-quality ggplot2 theme following Annenberg Institute Brown University visual identity. Uses brand fonts automatic Google Fonts fallback.

title: Annenberg Institute Base Theme — theme_aib
code: theme_aib(   base_size = 11,   base_family = NULL,   gridlines = c("none", "x", "y", "xy") )

title: Annenberg Institute Base Theme — theme_aib
text: base_size Base font size points. Default 11. base_family Override base font family. NULL, uses registered AIB body font. gridlines major gridlines display. One "none" (default), "x", "y", "xy".

title: Annenberg Institute Base Theme — theme_aib
text: ggplot2::theme() object.

title: Annenberg Institute Base Theme — theme_aib
code: library(ggplot2) ggplot(mtcars, aes(mpg, wt)) +   geom_point() +   theme_aib()   # Add horizontal gridlines ggplot(mtcars, aes(mpg, wt)) +   geom_point() +   theme_aib(gridlines = "y")

title: Annenberg Institute Grid Theme — theme_aib_grid
text: Identical theme_aib() defaults gridlines = "xy" light gray major gridlines. Use data-dense plots gridlines aid readability.

title: Annenberg Institute Grid Theme — theme_aib_grid
code: theme_aib_grid(   base_size = 11,   base_family = NULL,   gridlines = c("xy", "x", "y", "none") )

title: Annenberg Institute Grid Theme — theme_aib_grid
text: base_size Base font size points. Default 11. base_family Override base font family. NULL, uses registered AIB body font. gridlines major gridlines display. One "none" (default), "x", "y", "xy".

title: Annenberg Institute Grid Theme — theme_aib_grid
text: ggplot2::theme() object.

title: Annenberg Institute Grid Theme — theme_aib_grid
code: library(ggplot2) ggplot(mtcars, aes(mpg, wt)) +   geom_point() +   theme_aib_grid()

title: Annenberg Institute Map Theme — theme_aib_map
text: theme spatial/map plots axes, ticks, gridlines. Retains title, subtitle, caption styling.

title: Annenberg Institute Map Theme — theme_aib_map
code: theme_aib_map(   base_size = 11,   base_family = NULL,   gridlines = c("none", "x", "y", "xy") )

title: Annenberg Institute Map Theme — theme_aib_map
text: base_size Base font size points. Default 11. base_family Override base font family. NULL, uses registered AIB body font. gridlines major gridlines display. One "none" (default), "x", "y", "xy".

title: Annenberg Institute Map Theme — theme_aib_map
text: ggplot2::theme() object.

title: Annenberg Institute Map Theme — theme_aib_map
code: library(ggplot2) ggplot(mtcars, aes(mpg, wt)) +   geom_point() +   theme_aib_map()
